result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J Brinkman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater, Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 15CF130 & 15CF402 called together at 3:09 pm [Clerk SH] (Cases were scheduled for STC & FSSC)
Defendant Richard J Brinkman in court, in-custody, with Attorney Jeffrey Jacob De La Rosa. ADA Jeffrey Martin Shock appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
ADA Shock files amended information in case 15CF130; Service of Amended Information admitted; reading waived 
On Motion of the State, the Court dismisses repeater allegation on Count #4-15CF402

Constitutional rights reviewed; maximum penalties recited; plea of "No Contest" entered on Counts #1 & #3-15CF130 & Counts #1 & #4-15CF402; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; Court finds the plea has been entered freely, voluntarily, intelligently and accepts the plea, finds the Defendant guilty, and orders JOC entered.
On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses all remaining counts

On Count #1-15CF130, the Court sentences Mr. Brinkman to 2 years & 9 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 15 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 18 months.  This sentence is to commence consecutive to any previously imposed sentence

On Count #1-15CF402, the Court sentences Mr. Brinkman to 19 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year & 3 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 6 months.  This sentence is to commence concurrent to 15CF130-Count #1, but consecutive to any other sentence in being

On Count #4-15CF402, the Court sentences Mr. Brinkman to 2 years and 9 months, with an Initial Term of Confinement in Prison of 1 year & 3 months, and the maximum time to serve on Extended Supervision of 1 year and 6 months.  This sentence is to commence concurrent other sentences announced today, but consecutive to any previously imposed sentence 

All counts - The Court finds that the Defendant is eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program (Boot Camp) and the Substance Abuse Program. 
The Court gives 39 days credit for time already served. - 15CF130
The Court gives 49 days credit for time already served. - 15CF402

The Court orders as conditions of Extended Supervision:
--Maintain absolute sobriety
--Not possess or consume alcohol or illegal drugs
--AODA Assessment & Follow-through with any recommended treatment, per Agent
--To undergo any other type of assessment, treatment or counseling as per Agent
--No acts/threats of violence
--No presence in bars, taverns or liquor stores
--To pay all costs, fees, assessments, surcharges, including DNA surcharges
--To submit DNA Sample upon demand

15CF130-On Count #3, the Court sentences the Defendant: 
--To serve 12 months in the Jefferson County Jail, TO BE SERVED IN PRISON SYSTEM; to commence concurrent to Count #1-15CF130, but consecutive to any other sentence in being
--To pay fine of $2600 + costs = $4230 (includes $200 DNA Surcharge) + $59.06 blood testing fees (FAPD) = $4289.06 + $33 subpoena fees = $4322.06 to be reduced to civil judgment
--Revocation of drivers license for 36 months
--County alcohol/drug assessment ordered
--Victim impact panel attendance
--Ignition Interlock Device requirement/restrictions for: 36 months
--6 demerit points assessed

Felony Firearm and Voting-rights prohibitions/warnings given
Explanation of Determinate Sentence form given to the Defendant
Recess: 3:56 pm

Amended

If Brandon Brinkman is unwilling to co-sign the bond, then the Court imposes a $5000 CASH bond, with the same conditions except the requirement to reside with Brandon Brinkman.

Cases 15CF402 and 15CF130 called together at 8:47am [mo]
Reserve Judge Robert Mawdsley presiding for Branch IV
Defendant Richard J Brinkman in court with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa ADA Brookellen Teuber appears for the State of Wisconsin.

As to Case 15CF402:
Mr.Brinkman waives his right to Preliminary Hearing; the Court accepts this waiver and binds him over for Trial.

The Court and Counsel address the letter submitted by the victim requesting contact
--ADA Teuber objects to a bond modification
--Atty. De La Rosa gives arguments in support of bond modification allowing contact

--The Court modifies Mr. Brinkman's bond to allow contact with Rebecca Straight in the jail; once Mr. Brinkman is released/ hold is lifted the no contact order remains
--The Court also modifies Mr. Brinkman's bond to add the condition that there may be no discussion of the facts of the case with Rebecca Straight

Arraignment:
--service of Information admitted, reading waived
--the charges and maximum penalties are recited
--pleas of "not guilty" entered
--Atty. De La Rosa requests a Speedy Trial

As to Case 15CF130:

The Court and Counsel address the State's Motion for Bond Modification
--ADA Teuber gives arguments
--Atty. De La Rosa gives arguments
--The Court modifies the bond to $2000 CASH, with same non monetary conditions as previously ordered. 

recess:9:02am


NEXT: (1) Pretrial Conference on 1/6/16 at 9:00am (2)FSSC/ Status Conference on 1/19/16 at 3:00pm (3) Jury Trial on Case 15CF402 on 1/25 OR 1/26/16 at 8:30am
from ADA Shock requesting that 15CF130 be called along with 15CF402 on 12/11/15. ADA Shock advises that there is no statutory victim in 15CF130.
Courts response to 12-03-15 letter//Court will hear from the parties on this request following the prelim on 12-11-15
from non-party requesting amendment to the bond
If Brandon Brinkman is unwilling to co-sign the bond, then the Court imposes a $5000 CASH bond, with the same conditions except the requirement to reside with Brandon Brinkman.

case called at 1:17pm. [mo]
[Judge Randy Koschnick presiding for Branch II Intake]
Defendant Richard J Brinkman appears via videoconferencing from the Jefferson County Jail, in custody, with Attorney Jeffrey De La Rosa.  Public Service Special Prosecutor, Melanie Flint appears for the State of Wisconsin.  

Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Brinkman's eligibility for SPD representation depends on the Court's bond requirement
On agreement of counsel, the Court finds that the videoconferencing system is sight and sound sufficient. 

Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Bond Arguments given by Counsel 


The Court requires a $10,000  Signature bond, with conditions:
--no contact with Rebecca Straight
--No presence at 12 Spry Ave. #60, Fort Atkinson 
--no acts or threats of violence
--to maintain absolute sobriety
--no presence in bars, taverns, liquor stores
--The Court requires Mr. Brinkman to reside with his brother, Brandon Brinkman, at 946 Johnson St., Beloit, WI
--The Court imposes a curfew on Mr. Brinkman, he is to be at his residence from 9:00pm- 6:00am
--The Court requires Brandon Brinkman to co-sign the bond 

If Brandon Brinkman is unwilling to co-sign the bond, then the Court imposes a $5000 CASH bond, with the same conditions except the requirement to reside with Brandon Brinkman. 

The State does not waive Preliminary Hearing time limits
The Court and Counsel discuss scheduling. 
Atty. De La Rosa indicates that Mr. Brinkman is eligible for SPD representation. 

recess:  1:25  pm. 


NEXT: Preliminary Hearing on 12/11/15 at 8:30am
